Package io.github.ai4ci.abm.inhost

Interface InHostPhenomenologicalState.BiPhasicLogistic

All Superinterfaces:
Serializable
Enclosing interface:
InHostPhenomenologicalState
@Immutable public static interface InHostPhenomenologicalState.BiPhasicLogistic extends Serializable
A biphasic logistic model for viral load or immune response dynamics.

The response is modeled as the product of a logistic growth phase and a logistic decay phase: \[ y(t) = f(t; r_g, s_g) \cdot \left(1 - f(t; r_d, s_d)\right) \] where:

  • \( f(t; r, s) = \frac{1}{1 + \exp(-r(t - s))} \) is the logistic function,
  • \( r_g, s_g \): growth rate and midpoint,
  • \( r_d, s_d \): decay rate and midpoint.

This produces a unimodal curve with controllable rise, peak, and fall times. The model supports calibration from clinical data (onset, peak, duration).

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type
    Method
    Description
    default double
    adjusted(double x, double growthOffset, double decayOffset)
    Computes the biphasic logistic response with shifted growth and decay phases: \[ y(x) = f(x; r_g, s_g - g) \cdot \left(1 - f(x; r_d, s_d - d)\right) \] where \( g \) and \( d \) are offsets that shift the curve in time.
    static InHostPhenomenologicalState.BiPhasicLogistic
    calibrateImmuneActivity(double peakTime, double peakLevel, double halfLife)
    Calibrates a biphasic logistic model for immune activity: \( t_{\text{peak}} \): time of peak immune response, \( I_{\text{peak}} \): peak immune level, \( t_{\text{half}} \): half-life of immune activity. The decay phase is calibrated from \( I_{\text{peak}} \) to \( I_{\text{peak}}/2 \) over \( t_{\text{half}} \) days.
    static InHostPhenomenologicalState.BiPhasicLogistic
    calibrateViralLoad(double onsetTime, double peakDelay, double postPeakDuration, double thresholdLevel, double peakLevel)
    Calibrates a biphasic logistic model for viral load using clinical parameters: \( t_{\text{onset}} \): time of symptom onset, \( \Delta t_{\text{peak}} \): delay to peak viral load, \( \Delta t_{\text{post}} \): duration from peak to recovery threshold, \( y_{\text{threshold}} \): threshold for detectable virus, \( y_{\text{peak}} \): peak viral load (square-root transformed). The square root of \( y_{\text{peak}} \) is used to stabilize the logistic fit.
    double
    getDecayRate()
    Returns the decay rate parameter \( r_d \) of the logistic function.
    double
    getDecayTime()
    Returns the decay midpoint \( s_d \) of the logistic function.
    double
    getGrowthRate()
    Returns the growth rate parameter \( r_g \) of the logistic function.
    double
    getGrowthTime()
    Returns the growth midpoint \( s_g \) of the logistic function.
    default double
    getUnit()
    Computes the unit scaling factor for the logistic function, defined as the value of the growth phase at time zero: \[ \text{unit} = f(0; r_g, s_g) = \frac{1}{1 + \exp(-r_g(-s_g))} \] This represents the baseline viral load corresponding to a normalized exposure dose of 1.
    static double
    invF(double y, double r, double s)
    Inverse logistic function: solves \( f(x; r, s) = y \) for \( x \): \[ x = s - \frac{1}{r} \log\left(\frac{1 - y}{y}\right) \]
    static double
    rate(double x1, double y1, double x2, double y2)
    Computes the logistic rate \( r \) given two points \( (x_1, y_1) \), \( (x_2, y_2) \): \[ r = \frac{\log\left(\frac{1 - y_2}{y_2}\right) - \log\left(\frac{1 - y_1}{y_1}\right)}{x_1 - x_2} \] This is derived from the inverse logistic formula.
    static double
    time(double x1, double y1, double x2, double y2)
    The characteristic time \( s \) (midpoint) of the logistic function two points \( (x_1, y_1) \), \( (x_2, y_2) \).
    default double
    unadjusted(int x)
    Computes the unadjusted biphasic logistic response at time \( x \): \[ y(x) = f(x; r_g, s_g) \cdot \left(1 - f(x; r_d, s_d)\right) \]

  • Method Details

    • calibrateImmuneActivity

      static InHostPhenomenologicalState.BiPhasicLogistic calibrateImmuneActivity(double peakTime, double peakLevel, double halfLife)
      Calibrates a biphasic logistic model for immune activity:
      • \( t_{\text{peak}} \): time of peak immune response,
      • \( I_{\text{peak}} \): peak immune level,
      • \( t_{\text{half}} \): half-life of immune activity.
      The decay phase is calibrated from \( I_{\text{peak}} \) to \( I_{\text{peak}}/2 \) over \( t_{\text{half}} \) days.
      Parameters:
      peakTime - time of peak immune response
      peakLevel - peak immune activity level (0 \lt peak level \lt 1)
      halfLife - half-life of immune activity (time to decay from peak to half peak level)
      Returns:
      a calibrated InHostPhenomenologicalState.BiPhasicLogistic model for immune dynamics

    • calibrateViralLoad

      static InHostPhenomenologicalState.BiPhasicLogistic calibrateViralLoad(double onsetTime, double peakDelay, double postPeakDuration, double thresholdLevel, double peakLevel)
      Calibrates a biphasic logistic model for viral load using clinical parameters:
      • \( t_{\text{onset}} \): time of symptom onset,
      • \( \Delta t_{\text{peak}} \): delay to peak viral load,
      • \( \Delta t_{\text{post}} \): duration from peak to recovery threshold,
      • \( y_{\text{threshold}} \): threshold for detectable virus,
      • \( y_{\text{peak}} \): peak viral load (square-root transformed).
      The square root of \( y_{\text{peak}} \) is used to stabilize the logistic fit.
      Parameters:
      onsetTime - time of symptom onset
      peakDelay - delay from onset to peak viral load
      postPeakDuration - duration from peak viral load to recovery threshold
      thresholdLevel - viral load level corresponding to the detection threshold (0 \lt threshold level \lt 1)
      peakLevel - viral load level corresponding to the peak (0 \lt peak level \lt 1)
      Returns:
      a calibrated InHostPhenomenologicalState.BiPhasicLogistic model

    • invF

      static double invF(double y, double r, double s)
      Inverse logistic function: solves \( f(x; r, s) = y \) for \( x \): \[ x = s - \frac{1}{r} \log\left(\frac{1 - y}{y}\right) \]
      Parameters:
      y - target output (0 \lt y \lt 1)
      r - rate parameter
      s - midpoint
      Returns:
      the input \( x \) that yields output \( y \)

    • rate

      static double rate(double x1, double y1, double x2, double y2)
      Computes the logistic rate \( r \) given two points \( (x_1, y_1) \), \( (x_2, y_2) \): \[ r = \frac{\log\left(\frac{1 - y_2}{y_2}\right) - \log\left(\frac{1 - y_1}{y_1}\right)}{x_1 - x_2} \] This is derived from the inverse logistic formula.
      Parameters:
      x1 - first time point
      y1 - first value (0 \lt y1 \lt 1)
      x2 - second time point
      y2 - second value (0 \lt y2 \lt 1)
      Returns:
      the rate parameter \( r \gt 0 \)
      Throws:
      RuntimeException - if the computed rate is non-positive

    • time

      static double time(double x1, double y1, double x2, double y2)
      The characteristic time \( s \) (midpoint) of the logistic function two points \( (x_1, y_1) \), \( (x_2, y_2) \).
      Parameters:
      x1 - time point
      y1 - value at time point \(0 \lt y1 \lt 1\)
      x2 - second time point
      y2 - second value \(0 \lt y2 \lt 1\)
      Returns:
      the midpoint \( s \) corresponding to the given point and rate
      Throws:
      RuntimeException - if the computed midpoint is negative

    • adjusted

      default double adjusted(double x, double growthOffset, double decayOffset)
      Computes the biphasic logistic response with shifted growth and decay phases: \[ y(x) = f(x; r_g, s_g - g) \cdot \left(1 - f(x; r_d, s_d - d)\right) \] where \( g \) and \( d \) are offsets that shift the curve in time.
      Parameters:
      x - time since exposure
      growthOffset - shift in growth phase
      decayOffset - shift in decay phase
      Returns:
      the adjusted response value

      Returns:
      the decay rate

      Returns the decay midpoint \( s_d \) of the logistic function.
      Returns:
      the decay time (midpoint)

      double getGrowthRate()
      Returns the growth rate parameter \( r_g \) of the logistic function.

      the growth rate

    • getGrowthTime

      double getGrowthTime()
      Returns the growth midpoint \( s_g \) of the logistic function.
      Returns:
      the growth time (midpoint)

    • getUnit

      @Derived default double getUnit()
      Computes the unit scaling factor for the logistic function, defined as the value of the growth phase at time zero: \[ \text{unit} = f(0; r_g, s_g) = \frac{1}{1 + \exp(-r_g(-s_g))} \] This represents the baseline viral load corresponding to a normalized exposure dose of 1.
      Returns:
      the unit scaling factor for the logistic function

    • unadjusted

      default double unadjusted(int x)
      Computes the unadjusted biphasic logistic response at time \( x \): \[ y(x) = f(x; r_g, s_g) \cdot \left(1 - f(x; r_d, s_d)\right) \]
      Parameters:
      x - time since exposure
      Returns:
      the unshifted response value
